info.description:
Portainer API is an HTTP API served by Portainer. It is used by the Portainer UI and everything you can do with the UI can be done using the HTTP API.
Examples are available at https://gist.github.com/deviantony/77026d402366b4b43fa5918d41bc42f8
You can find out more about Portainer at [http://portainer.io](http://portainer.io) and get some support on [Slack](http://portainer.io/slack/).

# Authentication

Most of the API endpoints require to be authenticated as well as some level of authorization to be used.
Portainer API uses JSON Web Token to manage authentication and thus requires you to provide a token in the **Authorization** header of each request
with the **Bearer** authentication mechanism.

Example:

```
Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6MSwidXNlcm5hbWUiOiJhZG1pbiIsInJvbGUiOjEsImV4cCI6MTQ5OTM3NjE1NH0.NJ6vE8FY1WG6jsRQzfMqeatJ4vh2TWAeeYfDhP71YEE
```

# Security

Each API endpoint has an associated access policy, it is documented in the description of each endpoint.

Different access policies are available:

- Public access
- Authenticated access
- Restricted access
- Administrator access

### Public access

No authentication is required to access the endpoints with this access policy.

### Authenticated access

Authentication is required to access the endpoints with this access policy.

### Restricted access

Authentication is required to access the endpoints with this access policy.
Extra-checks might be added to ensure access to the resource is granted. Returned data might also be filtered.

### Administrator access

Authentication as well as an administrator role are required to access the endpoints with this access policy.

# Execute Docker requests

Portainer **DO NOT** expose specific endpoints to manage your Docker resources (create a container, remove a volume, etc...).

Instead, it acts as a reverse-proxy to the Docker HTTP API. This means that you can execute Docker requests **via** the Portainer HTTP API.

To do so, you can use the `/endpoints/{id}/docker` Portainer API endpoint (which is not documented below due to Swagger limitations). This endpoint has a restricted access policy so you still need to be authenticated to be able to query this endpoint. Any query on this endpoint will be proxied to the Docker API of the associated endpoint (requests and responses objects are the same as documented in the Docker API).

**NOTE**: You can find more information on how to query the Docker API in the [Docker official documentation](https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.30/) as well as in [this Portainer example](https://gist.github.com/deviantony/77026d402366b4b43fa5918d41bc42f8).

get.description:
List all endpoints based on the current user authorizations. Will
return all endpoints if using an administrator account otherwise it will
only return authorized endpoints.
**Access policy**: restricted

parameters.name: tagIds
parameters.description: search endpoints with these tags (depends on tagsPartialMatch)

parameters.name: tagsPartialMatch
parameters.description: If true, will return endpoint which has one of tagIds, if false (or missing) will return only endpoints that has all the tags

post.description:
Create a new endpoint that will be used to manage an environment.
**Access policy**: administrator

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Name that will be used to identify this endpoint (example: my-endpoint)

parameters.name: EndpointCreationType
parameters.description: Environment type. Value must be one of: 1 (Local Docker environment), 2 (Agent environment), 3 (Azure environment), 4 (Edge agent environment) or 5 (Local Kubernetes Environment

parameters.name: URL
parameters.description: URL or IP address of a Docker host (example: docker.mydomain.tld:2375). Defaults to local if not specified (Linux: /var/run/docker.sock, Windows: //./pipe/docker_engine)

parameters.name: PublicURL
parameters.description: URL or IP address where exposed containers will be reachable. Defaults to URL if not specified (example: docker.mydomain.tld:2375)

parameters.name: GroupID
parameters.description: Endpoint group identifier. If not specified will default to 1 (unassigned).

parameters.name: TLS
parameters.description: Require TLS to connect against this endpoint

parameters.name: TLSSkipVerify
parameters.description: Skip server verification when using TLS

parameters.name: TLSSkipClientVerify
parameters.description: Skip client verification when using TLS

parameters.name: AzureApplicationID
parameters.description: Azure application ID. Required if endpoint type is set to 3

parameters.name: AzureTenantID
parameters.description: Azure tenant ID. Required if endpoint type is set to 3

parameters.name: AzureAuthenticationKey
parameters.description: Azure authentication key. Required if endpoint type is set to 3

parameters.name: TagIDs
parameters.description: List of tag identifiers to which this endpoint is associated

parameters.name: EdgeCheckinInterval
parameters.description: The check in interval for edge agent (in seconds)

post.description:
Deploy a new stack into a Docker environment specified via the endpoint identifier.
**Access policy**: restricted

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Stack deployment type. Possible values: 1 (Swarm stack) or 2 (Compose stack).

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Stack deployment method. Possible values: file, string or repository.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: Identifier of the endpoint that will be used to deploy the stack

parameters.name: body_swarm_string
parameters.description: Required when using method=string and type=1

parameters.name: body_swarm_repository
parameters.description: Required when using method=repository and type=1

parameters.name: body_compose_string
parameters.description: Required when using method=string and type=2

parameters.name: body_compose_repository
parameters.description: Required when using method=repository and type=2

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Name of the stack. required when method is file

parameters.name: SwarmID
parameters.description: Swarm cluster identifier. Required when method equals file and type equals 1. required when method is file

parameters.name: Env
parameters.description: Environment variables passed during deployment, represented as a JSON array [{'name': 'name', 'value': 'value'}]. Optional, used when method equals file and type equals 1.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Stack file. required when method is file

get.description:
Retrieve details about a stack.
**Access policy**: restricted

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: Stacks created before version 1.18.0 might not have an associated endpoint identifier. Use this optional parameter to set the endpoint identifier used by the stack.

parameters.name: external
parameters.description: Set to true to delete an external stack. Only external Swarm stacks are supported

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: Endpoint identifier used to remove an external stack (required when external is set to true)

get.summary: Retrieve the content of the Stack file for the specified stack

Non-administrator users will only be able to list other non-administrator user accounts.

get.description:
If the nodeName query parameter is present, the request will be proxied to the underlying agent endpoint.
If the nodeName query parameter is not specified, the request will be upgraded to the websocket protocol and
an AttachStart operation HTTP request will be created and hijacked.
Authentication and access is controlled via the mandatory token query parameter.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: endpoint ID of the endpoint where the resource is located

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: JWT token used for authentication against this endpoint

get.description:
If the nodeName query parameter is present, the request will be proxied to the underlying agent endpoint.
If the nodeName query parameter is not specified, the request will be upgraded to the websocket protocol and
an ExecStart operation HTTP request will be created and hijacked.
Authentication and access is controlled via the mandatory token query parameter.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: endpoint ID of the endpoint where the resource is located

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: JWT token used for authentication against this endpoint

get.description:
The request will be upgraded to the websocket protocol.
Authentication and access is controlled via the mandatory token query parameter.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: JWT token used for authentication against this endpoint

edgeAgentCheckinInterval.description: The default check in interval for edge agent (in seconds)

enableEdgeComputeFeatures.description: Whether edge compute features are enabled

logoURL.description: URL to a logo that will be displayed on the login page as well as on top of the sidebar. Will use default Portainer logo when value is empty string

snapshotInterval.description: The interval in which endpoint snapshots are created

templatesURL.description: URL to the templates that will be displayed in the UI when navigating to App Templates

userSessionTimeout.description: The duration of a user session

env.description: A list of environment variables used during stack deployment

composeFilePathInRepository.description: Path to the Stack file inside the Git repository

env.description: A list of environment variables used during stack deployment

repositoryAuthentication.description: Use basic authentication to clone the Git repository

repositoryPassword.description: Password used in basic authentication. Required when RepositoryAuthentication is true.

repositoryReferenceName.description: Reference name of a Git repository hosting the Stack file

repositoryURL.description: URL of a Git repository hosting the Stack file

repositoryUsername.description: Username used in basic authentication. Required when RepositoryAuthentication is true.

endpointID.description: Endpoint identifier of the target endpoint where the stack will be relocated

name.description: If provided will rename the migrated stack

swarmID.description: Swarm cluster identifier, must match the identifier of the cluster where the stack will be relocated

env.description: A list of environment variables used during stack deployment

composeFilePathInRepository.description: Path to the Stack file inside the Git repository

env.description: A list of environment variables used during stack deployment

repositoryAuthentication.description: Use basic authentication to clone the Git repository

repositoryPassword.description: Password used in basic authentication. Required when RepositoryAuthentication is true.

repositoryReferenceName.description: Reference name of a Git repository hosting the Stack file

repositoryURL.description: URL of a Git repository hosting the Stack file

repositoryUsername.description: Username used in basic authentication. Required when RepositoryAuthentication is true.

env.description: A list of environment variables used during stack deployment

prune.description: Prune services that are no longer referenced (only available for Swarm stacks)

stackFileContent.description: New content of the Stack file

UpdateAvailable.description: Whether portainer has an update available

role.description: Role for the user inside the team (1 for leader and 2 for regular member)
Role for the user inside the team (1 for leader and 2 for regular member)

repositoryURL.description: URL of a git repository where the file is stored

role.description: User role (1 for administrator account and 2 for regular account)
User role (1 for administrator account and 2 for regular account)
